meta.context: Indian Gig Economy & Irregular Income Professionals
meta.purpose: Seed data for ArthSaathi AI Simulation Engine - Extended Dataset

display_profile.name: Ramesh Kumar
display_profile.bio: Ramesh rides his own bike for two major delivery apps. He chases 'Rainy Day' incentives and works 12-hour shifts. He supports his parents in the village.
display_profile.quote: If the wheel stops turning, the money stops coming.

simulation_context.active_goal: Complete 150 orders in 5 days for ₹5,000 Bonus

events.title: The Pothole Disaster
events.description: It is Day 2 of your Mega Bonus challenge. You hit a deep pothole in Indiranagar. Your bike's front suspension is damaged. It is rideable but very shaky and dangerous.

choices.text: Fix immediately at Authorized Service Center (₹3,000)
choices.outcome_narrative: You spend a chunk of savings, but the bike runs smooth. You feel safer, but now you are stressed about the low bank balance.
The mechanic ties it up with wire and basic welding. It works for now, but you drive with fear.
You save money, but your speed drops. You miss two deliveries because you had to drive slowly over bumps.

events.title: The Biryani Party
events.description: You just got your weekly payout of ₹4,500. Your roommates are celebrating a birthday at a local bar and want you to chip in ₹1,200.

choices.outcome_narrative: You had a great night, but waking up to see 25% of your weekly earnings gone hurts.
Your friends call you stingy, but your wallet is safe.

choices.text: Join but use BNPL (Buy Now Pay Later)
choices.outcome_narrative: You enjoyed the night without paying cash, but you started a debt cycle for a non-asset.

events.title: The Traffic Challan
events.description: You jumped a signal to deliver a warm pizza on time. A cop catches you. The official fine is ₹1,000.

choices.outcome_narrative: It hurts your wallet, but you have a clean receipt and no guilt.
You saved money, but you risk getting into deeper trouble if the cop refuses.
The cop lets you go with a warning after wasting an hour. You missed the peak lunch hour orders.

events.title: The Back Spasm
events.description: Constant riding has caused a severe back spasm. The doctor suggests 3 days of complete rest and medicines worth ₹800.

choices.outcome_narrative: You lose income, but your body recovers. Long term sustainability secured.

choices.text: Buy painkiller spray (₹150) and keep working
choices.outcome_narrative: You earn money today, but the pain is becoming chronic.

events.title: Data Exhausted
events.description: Mid-shift, you get a notification: 90% Data used. If data stops, you can't receive orders. You usually recharge for ₹299/month.

choices.outcome_narrative: It solves the problem for today only.
You secure the next month's connectivity.

events.title: Diwali Money
events.description: Parents call. They expect you to send ₹5,000 for Diwali sweets and clothes for the family in the village.

choices.outcome_narrative: Your savings are dangerously low, but your parents are happy.
Parents are disappointed, but you keep a safety buffer.

events.title: The Storm Surge
events.description: It's pouring rain. The app offers 'Rain Mode': Extra ₹30 per order. Roads are slippery.

choices.outcome_narrative: You made great money, but had two near-miss accidents.
You stayed dry and safe, but missed a prime earning window.

events.title: The Change Issue
events.description: A customer pays Cash on Delivery with a ₹500 note. You don't have change. He refuses to take the order unless you find change.

choices.text: Run to a shop to get change
choices.outcome_narrative: You solved it, but wasted peak time.

choices.text: Ask him to GPay you (He is annoyed)
choices.outcome_narrative: He pays but gives you a 1-star rating for 'Attitude'.

display_profile.name: Priya Desai
display_profile.bio: Priya earns well but sporadically. She struggles with the 'Feast and Famine' cycle—feeling rich when a check clears and poor two weeks later.
display_profile.quote: My bank account is a rollercoaster.

simulation_context.active_goal: Clear Credit Card debt before interest hits

events.title: The Advance Payment
events.description: A ₹75,000 advance just hit your account. You see a new iPad Pro (₹80k) that you've wanted for sketching. It's available on No-Cost EMI.

choices.outcome_narrative: You feel professional, but you've just added a ₹8,000 monthly commitment to an unstable income.
It gets the job done. You save the rest of the capital.

choices.text: Stick to old laptop, Save cash
choices.outcome_narrative: Work is slower, but your emergency fund is healthy.

events.title: The Client Ghosting
events.description: It is Month 2. The second installment of ₹75,000 is delayed. The client isn't replying. Rent (₹18,000) is due tomorrow. Bank balance: ₹10,000.

choices.outcome_narrative: Rent is paid, but you lost interest and dipped into your tax savings.
You solved the immediate problem but signed up for high-interest stress.
Embarrassing conversation, but you saved your financial health.

events.title: The Subscription Audit
events.description: You realize you are paying ₹5,000/month for Adobe, Notion, Figma, and Netflix. A new AI tool (₹2,000) looks cool.

choices.outcome_narrative: You have the best tools, but your fixed costs are bleeding you dry.
You swapped expenses. Net impact zero. Smart move.

events.title: The 'Help Me' Text
events.description: A college friend asks to borrow ₹10,000 for an 'emergency'. You have the cash, but it's for next month's rent.

choices.outcome_narrative: You helped a friend, but now your runway is shortened by 15 days.
It was awkward, but your financial stability is preserved.

events.title: March Madness
events.description: It's March 25th. You haven't organized your invoices for the year. A CA offers to do it for ₹5,000. Or do it yourself.

choices.outcome_narrative: Costly, but you save time and ensure no tax penalties.
You saved money but missed a deadline for a small client project due to time loss.

events.title: The Blue Screen
events.description: Your laptop crashes mid-project. Repair cost: ₹12,000. New Laptop: ₹90,000.

choices.outcome_narrative: It works, but you are nervous it will crash again.
You have a reliable machine, but your monthly EMI burden just doubled.

events.title: The Cheap Client
events.description: A client offers a bulk project for ₹40,000. Market rate is ₹80,000. They promise 'exposure' and 'future work'.

choices.text: Accept it to keep cash flowing
choices.outcome_narrative: You are busy, but working for half your worth leads to burnout.
You have zero income this week, but you maintained your premium positioning.

events.title: The Premium Hike
events.description: Your Health Insurance renewal is ₹12,000. You haven't been sick in 2 years.

choices.outcome_narrative: A big hit to savings, but you are protected against catastrophe.

choices.text: Let it lapse for a month
choices.outcome_narrative: You saved the cash. If you get Dengue tomorrow, you are bankrupt.

display_profile.name: Vikram Singh
display_profile.bio: Vikram bought a Swift Dzire on loan to drive for Uber/Ola. His income looks high on paper, but fuel and EMI eat 60% of it.
display_profile.quote: I work for the bank, not for myself.

events.title: The Insurance Renewal
events.description: Your comprehensive insurance is expiring. Cost: ₹15,000. You have exactly ₹18,000 in the bank.

choices.outcome_narrative: You are broke for the week, but you sleep well knowing the car is covered.
You saved cash, but if you hit a divider, the repair bill is all on you.
You are driving illegally. One police check or accident ends your career.

events.title: The Midnight Surge
events.description: It's 11 PM. You've driven 12 hours. Surge is 2.5x. You are dizzy with fatigue.

choices.outcome_narrative: You earned extra, but you nearly fell asleep at the wheel twice.
You lost the surge money, but you are fresh for the morning shift.

events.title: The Flat Tyre
events.description: Your front tyre bursts. It cannot be patched. A new tyre costs ₹4,500. A second-hand one costs ₹1,500.

choices.outcome_narrative: Expensive, but it will last 30,000 km.
It's cheap, but it might burst again in a month.

events.title: The Rowdy Passenger
events.description: A passenger vomits in your car. Cleaning will cost ₹600 and 2 hours off-road. He refuses to pay extra.

choices.outcome_narrative: He pays ₹500 out of fear, but reports you for 'Rude Behavior'. Rating drops.

choices.text: Let it go, clean it yourself
choices.outcome_narrative: You lost money and time, but avoided a platform strike.

events.title: The CNG Queue
events.description: CNG is ₹30 cheaper than Petrol. But the queue at the pump is 1.5 hours long.

choices.outcome_narrative: You saved on fuel, but lost potential fares during that time.
Higher running cost, but you kept the wheels moving.

events.title: Admission Fee
events.description: School admission fee is ₹10,000. Due date is tomorrow. You are short by ₹5,000.

choices.outcome_narrative: Fee paid. But you now have a high-interest shark on your back.
He gives it, but reminds you of the money you already owe him.

events.title: The Outstation Deal
events.description: A passenger offers ₹3,000 cash for a trip to Agra. If you go via App, you get ₹2,200.

choices.outcome_narrative: Great money. But if the car breaks down or accidents happen, no platform insurance covers you.
Less money, but you are tracked and insured.

events.title: The Bank Call
events.description: You missed last month's EMI. Bank calls: 'Pay double EMI (₹24,000) by Friday or we seize the car.'

choices.outcome_narrative: Car saved. But you lost a family asset that appreciates in value.

choices.text: Drive 18 hours a day for 5 days
choices.outcome_narrative: You might make the money, or you might crash the car from sleep deprivation.

display_profile.name: Anjali Mehta
display_profile.bio: Anjali runs a bakery from her kitchen. Orders come via Instagram. She struggles with separating household grocery money from business inventory costs.
display_profile.quote: Revenue is not Profit, but I keep forgetting that.

simulation_context.urgent_alert: Bulk order received, need raw materials.

events.title: The Bulk Order
events.description: A client wants 50kg of cakes for a reception. Revenue: ₹40,000. Advance paid: ₹5,000. You need ₹15,000 immediately for ingredients. Bank Balance: ₹8,000.

choices.text: Use House Rent money for ingredients
choices.outcome_narrative: You took the order, but now you are stressed about replacing the rent money before the 1st.
You used credit to fund operations. Smart if the client pays on time. Disaster if they delay.
You slept peacefully, but your business didn't grow.

events.title: Oven Trouble
events.description: Your main oven coil burns out 2 days before a delivery. Repair: ₹2,000 (1 day). Renting a neighbor's oven: ₹500 (immediate).

choices.outcome_narrative: Costly, but you own the asset.
Cheap fix, but inconvenient to carry trays back and forth.

events.title: The Christmas Flea Market
events.description: A popular mall offers a stall for ₹5,000. Expected sales: ₹15,000. But it's a gamble.

choices.outcome_narrative: You took a risk. If it rains, you lose money. If it shines, you gain customers.
Safe, but you miss brand visibility.

events.title: Too Many Orders
events.description: You are overworked. You can hire a helper for the month for ₹6,000.

choices.outcome_narrative: Your profit margin drops, but you can take double the orders.
You keep all the profit, but you are sleeping 4 hours a night.

events.title: The Smashed Cake
events.description: Dunzo/Uber guy dropped the cake. Customer is furious. Value: ₹1,500.

choices.outcome_narrative: Huge loss today, but the customer respects you and will return.
You saved the money, but the customer posts a nasty story on Instagram.

events.title: The Chocolate Deal
events.description: Wholesaler offers premium chocolate at 30% discount if you buy 10kg (₹8,000).

choices.outcome_narrative: Cash trapped in stock, but your margins will improve for 3 months.
You keep cash fluid, but pay higher prices per kg.

events.title: Husband Needs Cash
events.description: Your husband asks for ₹5,000 from your 'Business Box' for household repairs.

choices.outcome_narrative: Your business capital is gone. Now you can't buy the new molds you wanted.
Family friction, but business integrity maintained.

events.title: The Price War
events.description: A new baker in the neighborhood is selling cakes for ₹200 less than you.

choices.outcome_narrative: You keep customers, but you are working for peanuts now.
You lose price-sensitive clients, but keep the loyal ones.

display_profile.name: Suresh Reddy
display_profile.bio: Suresh gets jobs via a gig app (like Urban Company). He pays for his own travel and tools. The platform takes a 20% cut.
display_profile.quote: 5 stars is the difference between eating and starving.

simulation_context.urgent_alert: Gas filling kit leaking, needs replacement.

events.title: The Direct Deal
events.description: You fix an AC. The bill is ₹2,000. The customer offers: 'Cancel on the app, I will pay you ₹1,800 cash directly.' You save the commission, customer saves money.

choices.outcome_narrative: You made extra cash today. But if the app finds out (GPS tracking/Algorithms), you get banned permanently.
You earned less, but your profile remains safe and highly rated.

events.title: The Capacitor Price
events.description: AC Capacitor needs changing. Cost ₹300. Market rate charge is ₹800. You can tell the customer it's an 'imported' one and charge ₹1,200.

choices.outcome_narrative: High profit. But if the customer checks online prices, you get a 1-star review.
Decent profit, happy customer.

events.title: The Power Drill
events.description: Your manual screwdriver is slow. A Bosch Power Drill costs ₹4,000. It saves 15 mins per job.

choices.outcome_narrative: You are faster now. You can take 1 extra job per day.
Hard work, wrist pain, but cash saved.

events.title: The 5-Star Ransom
events.description: Customer says: 'Give me ₹200 discount or I will give you 3 stars.' You are at 4.6 rating (Danger zone).

choices.outcome_narrative: You bought the rating. It feels unfair, but you survived.
He gave 3 stars. Your average dropped to 4.5. You get fewer leads next week.

events.title: The Platform Loan
events.description: The App offers you a 'Partner Personal Loan' of ₹20,000 instantly. Deduction: ₹200/day from earnings.

choices.outcome_narrative: Easy money now, but your daily earnings will feel very small for months.
Smart. Never borrow against future labor.

events.title: Holi Weekend
events.description: It's Holi. High demand for cleaning. Triple rates. But your family wants you home.

choices.outcome_narrative: You made a week's income in a day. Family is sad, but the fridge is full.
Great memories, empty pocket.

events.title: Advanced Training
events.description: App requires you to attend 'Washing Machine Repair' training. Cost ₹500. 1 Day. Increases job variety.

choices.outcome_narrative: You lost money today, but now you qualify for higher-paying tickets.
You saved the fee, but you are stuck fixing cheap fans.

events.title: The Broken Vase
events.description: While moving a ladder, you accidentally break a customer's flower vase. Worth ₹800.

choices.outcome_narrative: You lost the profit from the job, but avoided a complaint.

choices.text: Deny it / Say it was already cracked
choices.outcome_narrative: You saved the money. Customer is furious and calls support.
